content.html:
My cousin, who I wrote about recently, has been discharged. This is the best and most significant news for my circle lately.

I have been listening to CMAT lately. I first started listening when I came across Jamie Oliver Petrol Station and now EURO-COUNTRY is on heavy rotation for me. It apparently has stopped a jerk from pursuing the Presidency of Ireland. Pop music power–this I like. And it’s a song that could make you cry too. I added it to my 2025 mix.

Nick Simson wrote about mixtapes recently and gave those mixes a shout which I appreciated. I mentioned in Mixtape Spruce-Ups the other day how much they mean to me.

I’ve been working on websites for artists for years. Soft-launched is the one for Marco Williams at northone.art who I met when I showed at WOCA a few months ago. Marco has a great eye.

And from the depths of history, I did a revamp of my ex-brother-in-law Richard Gate’s site: www.richardgate.com. It was heavily table based and didn’t behave or look particularly good on phone or tablet. It’s minimal. That ascetic design is directly related to the reluctance of the artist to put his paintings–on wood or canvas, usually quite large–it into words.

I created a new six-fingered emoji–an “ai hand” (derogatory)–and contributed it to the openmoji project (issue | pull request). The lab “6-finger emoji” page gets a steady little trickle of traffic for the one I made for Slack several years ago. It was fun to adapt for their paricular style. The code I wrote (an SVG file and some metadata) for this has now been merged. It aught to show up on their site at some point. It was Kris Kowal who pointed me to the project, over on Mastodon. The last time I mentioned Kris Kowal on this blog was in 2008, that’s 17 years ago, about a War of the Worlds reenactment which was super fun on Twitter: War of the Worlds 2.0.

the aforementioned hand

In other news, I’ve been bodysurfing a fair amount lately. But my Instagram usage is down. But there are some new videos over on the Videos page. That page is pretty unruly. I’ll get to it.

Thanks for reading. I’ve been ending my CSS Battle videos with something like:

It’s rough out there, be good to yourself, be good to others, and go make a web page

No more to say than that today. But I’ll add: tell someone you care about or whose work you like that you care about them. Whether email, or carrier pigeon or text message or Signal message or whatever, tell them.

Life is idiotically short and times are frustratingly hard.

My cousin, who I wrote about recently, has been discharged. This is the best and most significant news for my circle lately.
I have been listening to CMAT lately. I first started listening when I came across Jamie Oliver Petrol Station and now EURO-COUNTRY is on heavy rotation for me. It apparently has stopped a jerk from pursuing the Presidency of Ireland. Pop music power–this I like. And it’s a song that could make you cry too. I added it to my 2025 mix.

Nick Simson wrote about mixtapes recently and gave those mixes a shout which I appreciated. I mentioned in Mixtape Spruce-Ups the other day how much they mean to me.
I’ve been working on websites for artists for years. Soft-launched is the one for Marco Williams at northone.art who I met when I showed at WOCA a few months ago. Marco has a great eye.
And from the depths of history, I did a revamp of my ex-brother-in-law Richard Gate’s site: www.richardgate.com. It was heavily table based and didn’t behave or look particularly good on phone or tablet. It’s minimal. That ascetic design is directly related to the reluctance of the artist to put his paintings–on wood or canvas, usually quite large–it into words.
I created a new six-fingered emoji–an “ai hand” (derogatory)–and contributed it to the openmoji project (issue | pull request). The lab “6-finger emoji” page gets a steady little trickle of traffic for the one I made for Slack several years ago. It was fun to adapt for their paricular style. The code I wrote (an SVG file and some metadata) for this has now been merged. It aught to show up on their site at some point. It was Kris Kowal who pointed me to the project, over on Mastodon. The last time I mentioned Kris Kowal on this blog was in 2008, that’s 17 years ago, about a War of the Worlds reenactment which was super fun on Twitter: War of the Worlds 2.0.

Thanks for reading. I’ve been ending my CSS Battle videos with something like:

It’s rough out there, be good to yourself, be good to others, and go make a web page

No more to say than that today. But I’ll add: tell someone you care about or whose work you like that you care about them. Whether email, or carrier pigeon or text message or Signal message or whatever, tell them.
